title: BlitzAnalysiz()
content:
BlitzAnalysiz() Welcome to BitzAnalysiz(), a site about in-depth analysis of World of Tanks Blitz game statistics. Here you can find (data-backed) answers to questions like:
 “What is the most over-powered tank in the game?" “What is the most played tank in the game?" “How is players’ WR distributed over the tiers?".  Stats for the latest update	Highest performing tanks	Most played tanks	Total battles by players	Latest posts  Blitzanalysiz.com launched   Other great WoT Blitz sites  BlitzStars - Player statistics BlitzStars Tank Compare - Tank comparison tool Blitz Hangar - Tank knowledge base WoTinspector.com - Tank armor analysis, Replays, Map inspector and more

title: Career stats
content:
This page shows statistics of players’ battles fought during their Blitz “career” until the end of update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of total battles per player in the end of the update 6.9. An average player has played 4887 battles by the end of update 6.9. Median battle count was 2430 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) was 163018 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update (i.e. “90% most inactive” == “10% most active”).
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played until the end of 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip: 10% most active players have played more than the 90% most inactive players.

title: Tier X stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier X during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 115 battles. Median was 45 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 5019 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

Only players with more than 10 battles at the tier are included.

title: Update 6.9
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.9. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9. On average, players played 383 battles. Median was 236 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 7230 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

title: Tier IX stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier IX during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 104 battles. Median was 54 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 3986 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     0% 1   10% 3   25% 13   50% 54   75% 140   90% 265   100% 3986      Player WR distribution The following graph shows a histogram of players (y-axis) with certain WR during the update 6.9 (x-axis). Only players with more than 10 battles at the tier are included.
Share of battles per nation per tank type This chart shows share of battles per nation per tank type at tier IX.

title: Blog
content:
Blitzanalysiz.com launched  Hy!
BlitzAnalysiz.com is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the player population and tank performance statistics.

title: Stats by tier
content:
This page shows player statistics per tier played during update 6.9. Tank statistics per tier can be found here.
Average tier WR vs average tier This graph shows player WR vs. average tier during the update 6.9. Minimum 50 battles required.
Share of players per WR per tier This chart shows share of players with certain WR (bar color-code) at certain tier (x-axis). Each players’ battles at different tiers have been taken into account as long as the player as at least 100 battles at a tier during the update.
Number of Battles per tier Share of battles per tank type per tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier with with particular tank type during update 6.9. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (136633758).
Share of battles per tank type per tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier with with particular tank type during update 6.9. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (136633758).

title: Tier VIII stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier VIII during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 125 battles. Median was 64 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 3633 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     0% 1   10% 3   25% 15   50% 64   75% 171   90% 321   100% 3633      Player WR distribution The following graph shows a histogram of players (y-axis) with certain WR during the update 6.9 (x-axis). Only players with more than 10 battles at the tier are included.
Share of battles per nation per tank type This chart shows share of battles per nation per tank type at tier VIII.

title: Stats by Region
content:
This page shows statistics per Blitz servers/regions (EU, NA, ASIA, Russia) during update 6.9. Statistics for the Chinese server are not available via WG API.
Number of players This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.
WR Distribution This graph shows how the players overall WR during update 6.9 is distributed on diferent regions.
Cumulative distribution function This graphs shows the same information than the previous in different format. The curve tells how large share of players (y-axis) had WR less than (x-axis) during update 6.9.

title: Tier VII stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier VII during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 82 battles. Median was 42 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 3592 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

title: Tier V stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier V during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 47 battles. Median was 15 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 3715 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

title: Tier IV stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier IV during update 6.9.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 20 battles. Median was 7 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 2607 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     0% 1   10% 1   25% 2   50% 7   75% 21   90% 47   100% 2607      Player WR distribution The following graph shows a histogram of players (y-axis) with certain WR during the update 6.9 (x-axis). Only players with more than 10 battles at the tier are included.
Share of battles per nation per tank type This chart shows share of battles per nation per tank type at tier IV.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
content:
1. Where is the data from All the data has been collected from WG API, stored in a database and processed with R/RStudio.
2. Are your numbers correct? Is there bias in the numbers? The statistics have been calculated from a data set with very high number of players (600,000+) and battles (in total 6bn+). That is maybe 4 times the data Blitzstars.com has, but there is still sampling bias as there is in Blitzstars’ numbers. This is evidenced by the overall WR distribution and the share of all wins out of all the battles in the database being above 50%. This is a topic worth of a longer post - stay tuned.
3. Why did you make the site? Out of pure interest into analysizing Blitz game statistics and to learn data analysis and R.
4. What is “Relative WR”? Relative WR the average WR players achieve with the tank compared to their other same tier tanks. If the tank is perfectly balanced, its Relative WR is 0 %. Large positive Relative WR indicates the tank is “very good” (read “OP”). Negative Relative WR indicate the tank performce worse than other same tier tanks. Relative WR is the 2nd best measure of tank’s performance, IMHO.
  Relative WR R code   rWR = Relative WR
stats.data.table[, WR.tier := sum(all.wins)/battles.tier, by=.(account_id, tier)]; stats.data.table[, tanks.tier := .N, by=.(account_id, tier)]; stats.data.table[ tanks.tier > 1, rWR := WR - (battles.tier*WR.tier - all.wins)/(battles.tier - all.battles)]; The bit cryptic syntax is R’s data.table - one of the fastest software packages for data analysis.
  5. Is BlitzAnalysiz()’ Relative WR different from Blitzstars’ one? Yes. At the moment Blitzstars.com calculate the Relative WR as WR difference to the players’ average WR over all their tanks. BlitzAnalysiz() considers only the other same tier tanks. Please note that the tank itself is excluded of the average WR in BlitzAnalysiz()’ calculations, but included in BlitzStars’ calculations. This may extra cause bias with hugely popular tanks.
6. I spotted a mistake or I have a question/request All the feedback on the site is welcome. You can reach out me via email (Jylpah@gmail.com), Discord (Jylpah#4662). I am also active at WoT Blitz EU forums.

title: About
content:
BlitzAnalysiz() is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz WWII-themed multiplayer tank game. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the overall player population and tank performance statistics.
The statistics shown at the site are based on maybe the largest collection of Blitz player stats outside Wargaming’s servers containing over 100 million individual tank statistics from more than 600,000 players from EU, RU, Asia and North American servers.
All the data has been fetched via WG’s API, stored in a database and processed in RStudio. The web site has been build with Hugo.
Big thanks for BlitzStars.com‘s developer SockRobber and WotInspector.com‘s developer reven86 for all the support!
BlitzAnalysiz() is build by Jylpah@EU. You can reach out me via email (Jylpah@gmail.com), Discord (Jylpah#4662). I am also active at WoT Blitz EU forums.
